pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:0.5: 71. The training rule on walking behind
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking behind while giving teachings to people walking in front. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.3: “‘I will not give teachings while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.4: One should not give teachings while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings while walking behind to someone walking in front who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.9: The eleventh training rule is finished.
